customer_name: Ervin Miller Marcus Miller Anna May Miller
site_name: Ervin Miller Marcus Miller Anna Mary Miller

citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors).
citations.narrative:
A brown and white female Shit-tzu (#65)'s right eye was hazy and the surface irregular. The attending veterinarian (AV)
prescribed daily treatments this March, however the licensee said that treatments haven't been continued consistently for
the last 1-2 weeks. I spoke with the AV who expressed that the treatments should continue daily. Not continuing an eye
treatment for a dog could prevent the condition from improving. Ensure that the prescribed treatment is continued and
communicate with the attending veterinarian on any changes observed with the eye condition.
***Correct from 4/19/2024 forward.

Under the first three flapper doors on the south side of the building there is excessive rust. Hair and soiled material was
observed under the middle door of these three doors. These areas are preventing the areas under the door to be
maintained clean. Ensure that the surface are maintained free from rust that prevents regular cleaning and sanitation.
***Correct by April 27, 2024.

-There is some wire along the east side of the building in the exercise pen that has some points dogs could contact. Wire
points could cause injury. Ensure to remove and maintain wire free from sharp points.
-Also, one flapper door is broken on the south side of the building. Broken plastic can form sharp edges and cause injury.
Ensure surfaces are maintained free from jagged edges or sharp points.
***Correct both items by April 23, 2024.

The floor around a new pallet of food stored for the dogs had mouse droppings around it. The bags were observed to be
intact and not have evidence of mice chewing on them, however mouse droppings can contaminate the food make
animals sick and are a sign that rodents have been present. Ensure that safe and effective pest control is in place and
that the area around food storage is maintained clean in a manner that protects the supplies from vermin/rodent
infestation.
***Correct by April 26, 2024.

The facility has been transitioning to having a new Attending Veterinarian (AV) make regular visits, however the facility's
written program of veterinary care (PVC) is incomplete and hasn't been developed and signed by the proposed AV. The
future AV did confirm visiting the facility and that the licensee has requested a written PVC to be developed. Having a
written PVC developed and signed by the AV helps ensure that adequate veterinary care is in place for the animals at the
facility. Ensure to work with the AV to develop and maintain a written PVC that is also signed by the AV.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
n

narrative:
2.40(b)(2) 
   
Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors). 
A brown and white female Shit-tzu (#65)'s right eye was hazy and the surface irregular. The attending veterinarian (AV) 
prescribed daily treatments this March, however the licensee said that treatments haven't been continued consistently for 
the last 1-2 weeks. I spoke with the AV who expressed that the treatments should continue daily. Not continuing an eye 
treatment for a dog could prevent the condition from improving. Ensure that the prescribed treatment is continued and 
communicate with the attending veterinarian on any changes observed with the eye condition.  
***Correct from 4/19/2024 forward. 
3.1(c)(1)(i) 
   
Housing facilities, general. 
Under the first three flapper doors on the south side of the building there is excessive rust. Hair and soiled material was 
observed under the middle door of these three doors. These areas are preventing the areas under the door to be 
maintained clean. Ensure that the surface are maintained free from rust that prevents regular cleaning and sanitation.  
***Correct by April 27, 2024. 
3.1(c)(1)(ii) 
   
Housing facilities, general. 
-There is some wire along the east side of the building in the exercise pen that has some points dogs could contact. Wire 
points could cause injury. Ensure to remove and maintain wire free from sharp points.  
-Also, one flapper door is broken on the south side of the building. Broken plastic can form sharp edges and cause injury. 
Ensure surfaces are maintained free from jagged edges or sharp points. 
 ***Correct both items by April 23, 2024. 
3.1(e) 
   
Housing facilities, general. 
The floor around a new pallet of food stored for the dogs had mouse droppings around it. The bags were observed to be 
intact and not have evidence of mice chewing on them, however mouse droppings can contaminate the food make

animals sick and are a sign that rodents have been present. Ensure that safe and effective pest control is in place and 
that the area around food storage is maintained clean in a manner that protects the supplies from vermin/rodent 
infestation.  
***Correct by April 26, 2024. 
3.13(a)  Repeat
   
Veterinary care for dogs. 
The facility has been transitioning to having a new Attending Veterinarian (AV) make regular visits, however the facility's 
written program of veterinary care (PVC) is incomplete and hasn't been developed and signed by the proposed AV. The 
future AV did confirm visiting the facility and that the licensee has requested a written PVC to be developed. Having a 
written PVC developed and signed by the AV helps ensure that adequate veterinary care is in place for the animals at the 
facility. Ensure to work with the AV to develop and maintain a written PVC that is also signed by the AV. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
